notes_display: Discoloration rim, small patina on the obverse; Analysis by A.A. Gordus, University of Michigan 1974, by Neutron activation of streak
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: Covered crown cap surmounted by covered korymbos; plain diadem; pendent diadem ribbons; cheek flaps; tunica; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h .l. o. mzdysn bgy 'rthštr MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n|mazdēsn bay Ardašir šāhān šāh Ērān kē čihr az yazdān | "the Mazda-worshiping, divine Ardashir, King of Kings of the Iranians, whose image / brilliance is from the gods"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical strokes; to the left and right mushroom-shaped bases supporting lion-paw structures; below left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbon; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 11 h .l. o. NWRA YZ- 3 h l. a. 'rthštr|ādur ī Ardašīr | “the fire of Ardashir”
issue_references_s: SNS 1 Phase 3 Group / Mint C “Ctesiphon" Type IIIb/3b, flame 3
